entry.title: Implementing Tablets that Run SAP EWM.
entry.content:
Hello
I want to implement tablets for my Inventory management team. We used to work with RF but it does not show as many information as we would like, so we have to carry laptops to almost every place we plan to do inventory and analysis. Can we use SAP EWM on a tablet that runs WINDOWS 10-11? We use decentralized ERP-EWM, but we only need EWM in order to visualize more information. 
Thanks.

entry.title: Cannot Delete
SAP Asset Manager 2410 - Branded prebuilt Client
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are currently working for a customer on implementing the SAP Service & Asset manager 2410 application. As part of that, we are aiming to generate the SAP Service & asset manager client with pre-built database to overcome the initial download time(sync time). can you please let me know if it is possible to generate the SSAM client with the pre-built database (similar to SAP Work Manager Agentry pre-built client)?

Kind Regards,

entry.title: SAP BTP Mobile Services Native/MDK App Deep Link Set-up
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I would like to inquire what is wrong with my set-up on providing a deep link towards MDK app. I am following the tutorial from (Implement Deep Linking into an MDK Application | SAP Tutorials). Despite the fact that I use the given repository via cloning the project and follow the steps, my Android application deep link is giving HTTP400.

It is configured in the mobile services cockpit in Application Links --> Android App Links (as per the steps defined in the tutorial). The URL I am calling is following the same set-up,

https://<Site Domain>/mobileservices/deeplinks/product?id=328723. Nevertheless, I am desperate and would highly appreciate your advice. 

Br,
Aleks.

entry.title: MDK Binding and Control access issues
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a couple of issues when developing my MDK App. The flow of my application is:

- We start on Main page, where Simple Property is used for Search.

- User provides Article Number in the Search field (or uses barcode scanning).

- When clicking 'Search' a Function Import using an Action is triggered. FI returns an Article Object.

- Then we want to show Article Object data below the Search field (preffered option is KeyValue fields).

We have following issues:

1. Cannot retrieve KeyValue control from Main page. While we can get 'ArticleDescriptionLabel', for 'Type' we get error: 'Could not find control 'Type' in view hierarchy'.

 
export default function ArticleFound(clientAPI) {
    let actionResult = clientAPI.getActionResult("SearchArticle");

    if (actionResult && actionResult.data) {
        let articleData = actionResult.data;

        try {
            let articleDescriptionLabel = clientAPI.evaluateTargetPath("#Page:Main/#Control:ArticleDescriptionLabel");
            articleDescriptionLabel.setText(articleData.Description);
            articleDescriptionLabel.redraw();
 
            let surnameKeyValue = clientAPI.evaluateTargetPath("#Page:Main/#Control:Type");
            surnameKeyValue.setValue(articleData.Type);
            surnameKeyValue.redraw();
        } catch(error) {
            alert(error);
        }
    }
}
 
Here's control tree:

The name of KeyValue this case is 'Type'.

2. As you can see our Code above, we receive Article object from Function Import via the Rule, but we don't know what's the best way to display the Article data in the view (e.g. many KeyValues or SimpleProperties). 

The only option we've found is accessing controls and then using setValue, setText methods, as above. But the code is redundant, and it would be better to use bindings.

We tried using Client Data, but then the value of the control is not being updated. It's like the binding is not refreshed.

            let pageProxy = clientAPI.getPageProxy();
            let pageClientData = pageProxy.getClientData();
            pageClientData.description = articleData.Description;
Then here's our binding:
Unfortunately, no luck. We tried using bindings, but without luck too.
 
3.  SimpleProperty missing events.
 

The only event we can use in SimpleProperty is OnValueChange for now. But it gets triggered each time a character is typed. Is there any option to call it once, only when typing is done? iOS keyboard has 'Done' button, which could be used to trigger 'Submit' event or 'ValueChanged'. In our case we want to trigger a function import when User types a complete Article Number. We can't trigger it OnValueChange. In SAPUI5, as an example - SearchField has different events, like 'change' and 'liveChange', which helps a lot. sap.m.SearchField - API Reference - Demo Kit - SAPUI5 SDK

4.  Bluetooth support. 

If we start using nativescript ble package for Bluetooth device scanning, will it work in SAP Mobile Start when we deploy our app to Cloud, or it works with branded MDK client only? When we develop the app and use SAP Mobile Services client from App Store for app preview, will we be able to test our NativeScript plugins? what's the best way to develop and test such extensions?

BR,

Adrian

entry.title: SAP MDK - possibly incorrect OData-Binding: Filling DataTable ListPicker
entry.content:
I'm having trouble filling the ListPicker options in a DataTableColumnItem via OData with "Object binding on entityset".
I need different options depending on the row. But the custom filter string in a rule that makes use of a row's bound values (=>clientAPI.binding.*) doesn't work, because before options are fetched for each row, there seems to be another fetching. This I know, because the rule supplying the filter string is called one more time than there are rows and the problem is that the clientAPI.binding there is bound to the parent entity, thus not containing the values that are accessed in the filter string. Because of this, no options are loaded into the ListPicker.

Now, if I instead try to fill the ListPicker via "binding" manually via a rule, the options are the same for every row. To see if that is the case by design, I next tried and simply returned one option, the option being the current time in milliseconds (Date.now()), I probably should be seeing a different time stamp in the DisplayString of every row's ListPicker options for all the different function calls, but it is always the same timestamp.

Please help, @bill_froelich

entry.title: Is there a way to enable ILX on the mobile app?
entry.content: We are going to enable the ILX as the default for our full LMS population with 1H2025. Is there a way to push this change on the mobile app without asking users to adjust their settings?

entry.title: SAP MDK - search filter does not work for some letters of the Czech diacritics
entry.content:
Hello, in SAP Asset Manager, MDK 24.4.3, the search filter (in pages like FunctionalLocationListViewPage) does not work for special Czech characters 'Č' and 'Ú'. For example, word "ústí" works OK, but "Ústí" does not.

this is in filter: `substringof('${searchString.toLowerCase()}', tolower(FuncLocDesc))`

Are there any settings or other functions so that the special characters are recognized correctly?

entry.title: [MDK] CreateRelatedMedia override media property from rule not working
entry.content:
I am using MDK version 24.11.3-001 on Android.  I have an Attachment Control where the user will be adding several images at once, then will click a Save button to upload the attachments to the backend.  The backend is a v2 OData service, and I have a Media entity set that is access through a navigation path (eg /Delivery('123')/Attachment/$value).

I have a CreateRelatedMedia action to perform the upload.  Once the save is complete, I would like to take another action, such as closing the page and returning to the list.  Furthermore, I'd like to add a SLUG header to include the filename for each individual file in the attachment control.

To accomplish these two desires, I believe the best way would be to loop through the attachments in a rule, and execute the action by overriding the properties for each loop.  The documentation indicates that the Media property should be an object with a "content" property and a "contentType" property.  

    let attachments = clientAPI.evaluateTargetPath('#Page:DeliveryAttachment/#Control:FormCellAttachment0/#Value');
    let uploadPromises = [];
    for (let i = 0; i < attachments.length; i++) {
        const attachment = attachments[i];
        const content = attachment.content;
        const contentType = attachment.contentType;
        const filename = attachment.urlString;
        const actionPromise = clientAPI.executeAction({
            "Name": '/myapp/Actions/DeliveryAttachments/OData/CreateDeliveryAttachmentRelatedMedia.action',
            "Properties": {
                "Media": {
                    "content": content,
                    "contentType": contentType
                },
                "Headers": {
                    "SLUG": filename
                }         
            }
        });
        uploadPromises.push(actionPromise);        
    }
    return Promise.all(uploadPromises).then(
        () => {
            clientAPI.executeAction('/myapp/Actions/ClosePage.action')
        }
    );

 I've tested this on both Web and Android and I get an exception from the MDK code (although each version throws an exception at different spots - I'm really only concerned with the Android functionality, so below I've shown the error from the Android device).  I've tried several different variations of this code, so I think the code is correct, but please let me know if I've done something wrong in my code.

On the Android device, the exception is raised from node_modules/mdk-sap/ODate/crud/ODataRelatedMediaCreator.ts:

As mentioned I get a similar error in Web, although from a different place in the code.

Have I encountered an issue or is there something I'm doing wrong in the code, or should I take a completely different approach?  (Note I've tried just executing the action and using the attachment control #Value in the media property, which will upload each attachment in the control - but the issue is that if I put another action in the Success Action, this success action gets executed for each attachment in the control).

Thanks!

I have also attached the error log details and the Create Media action details. I hope this helps.

Thank you for your help.

Aditya

entry.title: Splash Screen - SAP BTP Mobile Service - Not Working - MDK 24.11.3
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I am currently trying to implement the use of a Splash Screen in an application built on SAP BTP Mobile Service, but despite following all the reference documentation, I have not been able to get it to work correctly.

https://help.sap.com/doc/f53c64b93e5140918d676b927a3cd65b/Cloud/en-US/docs-en/guides/getting-started/mdk/custom-client/app-icon-splash-screen.html

I used the following configuration to set up the launcher and splash screen icons and applied it in the MDKProject.json file as instructed.

I’m using the following configuration to load the launcher and splash screen icons. I'm also adding the image folder using the same names and path as specified in the documentation.

However, neither the launcher icon nor the splash screen background appear in the app, even though everything seems to be set up as described. The project was built successfully without errors.

@robinkuck @bill_froelich @Jitendra_Kansal78 

Thank you very much for your help. If any additional information is needed, I remain at your disposal.

SDK versions currently available in Mobile Services

NEW UPDATE:

With the new SDK version enabled, we were able to build the app successfully, and it worked correctly on iOS. However, on Android we noticed a specific behavior:

  • When the icon is not provided during the build process, only a pink border is displayed (see image 1). I’d like to confirm if that border is the expected behavior on Android, or if that’s all we can achieve — since on iOS the entire background is visible (see image 2).

                          

  • If we upload the icon, it appears enlarged, and the pink border is no longer visible (see image 3), which differs from how it looks when the icon is not included (image 4).

entry.title: Custom Theming - SAP BTP Mobile Service - Not Working - MDK 25.6.0
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I am currently trying to implement Custom Theming in an application built on SAP BTP Mobile Service, but despite following all the steps in the reference documentation, it has not worked as expected.

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/sdk-ios-custom-theme..html 

I have enabled the "Enable Custom Theme" option and activated the theme I added to my application, following the documented steps. However, the custom theme is still not being reflected in the app.

For context, please note that our application is built using a Customized Mobile Development Kit (MDK) Client, not the standard one provided by SAP. I’m not sure if this could be affecting the theming behavior, but I wanted to mention it just in case it’s relevant.

Currently, the app still looks the same as before (as shown in the image on the right), even with the custom theme active. What we expected was for it to reflect the new colors and styles defined in the theme (similar to the image on the left).

                   

@robinkuck @bill_froelich @Jitendra_Kansal78 

Thank you very much for your help. If any additional information is needed, I remain at your disposal.

entry.title: Uploading images to an external repository—can anyone help me?
entry.content:
Hello experts, can someone help me? I have a SAP Mobile MDK application and I'm using the Attachment control to capture images from a mobile device. The image taken from the device needs to be sent to a repository so it can be accessed later.

Can you please tell me what steps I need to follow? What should I configure? Do I need to convert the image in any way?

I’ve used a Send Request action, and I’ve only been able to create the record, but the image is not being sent.

Is it possible for someone to guide me through the process or point me to any tutorial, documentation, or link that I can follow?

I appreciate the time you take to help me.

entry.title: Cannot view/see goals on mobile
entry.content:
Hi Experts. Would appreciate some help on this issue.

Goals cannot be viewed on mobile when accessed via Navigation Bar > Profile > Performance and Goals (but is visible via the same path on web)

The goals however can be viewed on mobile via Navigation Bar > Goals. 

SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals SAP SuccessFactors Mobile

entry.title: SAP B1 Sales Mobile App - Crystal Report with Command Parameters
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a Crystal Report that applies a filter using this parameter:
A1@ Select Distinct "U_Familia" From OITM Order By "U_Familia" Asc

It works fine in Crystal Reports and SAP Business One.

However, in the B1 Sales mobile app, it doesn't work correctly.
It displays the parameters, but they don’t function properly.

But when you open one, a list of articles appears and not the "Familia" and "SubFamilia" list.

 

Note: The PDF is displayed correctly; the only issue is with the dropdowns, which should display the "Family" and "SubFamily" lists.

entry.title: Avatar Stack sizing in SAP MDK
entry.content:
So I am creating sap mdk app. 

I am using object table to display internet store style objects. 

On mobile device (and android studio emulator) icons from avatar stack are kinda small. I tried to resize them using styless.less but i found that height and width for images is not supported. 

i found this github library: https://github.com/SAP-samples/cloud-mdk-samples/tree/main/Showcase_Apps/ImageHandlingApp

where i can see better looking icon sizing. It is also done by avatar stack. but here it looks like images are bigger than in my app. How do i achieve that?

Thank you

Jakub Szałek

entry.title: Help Needed : Your apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I recently received a notification from Google Play stating that my apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements.

Here is the message from Google Play :

3 of your apps are affected by Google Play's 16 KB page size requirements
" To ensure that your app works correctly on the latest versions of Android, Google Play requires all apps targeting Android 15+ to support 16 KB memory page sizes.

From 1 May 2026, if your app updates do not support 16 KB memory page sizes, you won't be able to release these updates. "

Could someone guide me on this?

Thank you,

entry.title: I am facing issue while debugging SAP MDK code in VS code
entry.content:
I am trying to debug in VS Code using MDK with "Attach on Android". The output shows "Attached on Android (Android emulator detected)", but the debugger is not stopping at any breakpoints. Instead, it’s ignoring them and showing the following error in the Debug Console:

"Breakpoint ignored because generated code not found (source map problem?)"

"SourceMaps.getMapForGeneratedPath: exception while processing path: C:\Users\AKASHW~1\AppData\Local\Temp\MDKDebug\emulator-5554\com.grasim.smaMaiApp\bundle.492.js, sourcemap: bundle.js.map
SyntaxError: Unterminated string in JSON at position 212972 (line 1 column 212973)
at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
at new SourceMap (c:\Users\Akash Washimkar\.vscode\extensions\sapse.vsc-extension-mdk-1.31.0\node_modules\vscode-chrome-debug-core\out\src\sourceMaps\sourceMap.js:19:25)
at c:\Users\Akash Washimkar\.vscode\extensions\sapse.vsc-extension-mdk-1.31.0\node_modules\vscode-chrome-debug-core\out\src\sourceMaps\sourceMapFactory.js:58:28"

Please refer to the attached screenshot. I'm getting this debugger console error and need help resolving it as soon as possible.

https://help.sap.com/docs/service-asset-manager/upgrading-sap-service-and-asset-manager/sap-s-4hana-and-sap-service-and-asset-manager-app-compatibility?locale=zh-CN

entry.title: AI for SAC mobile
entry.content:

I want to display the Just-Ask search function in my mobile app as well.

How can I go about enabling this?
